layer.name: Causality
layer.definition: Actions have consequences; you reap what you sow.

questions.text: My thinking patterns are shaped by what I consistently consume ...

answers.4: mostly — consumption patterns clearly affect thinking
answers.5: directly — content, conversations, and information shape my mind
answers.2: possibly — but I can filter what affects me
answers.3: somewhat — some inputs shape me, others I can resist
answers.1: not really — I think independently of inputs

questions.text: The connection between information diet and worldview is ...

answers.4: strong — what goes in shapes what comes out
answers.5: direct — garbage in, garbage out applies to the mind
answers.3: partial — some influence, but I can think critically
answers.1: weak — I form my own views independently

questions.text: People who think clearly got that way through specific practices ...
questions.principle: Mental clarity results from mental discipline

answers.4: mostly — clear thinking is built through discipline
answers.5: definitely — clarity is trained, not born
answers.2: possibly — but intelligence seems mostly innate
answers.3: partially — practice helps, but gifts matter more
answers.1: not necessarily — some people are just naturally sharp

questions.text: Chronic anxiety, negativity, or confusion often have identifiable inputs ...

answers.4: usually — I can identify what's feeding negative states
answers.5: almost always — mental states have causal roots
answers.2: possibly — but the causes are hard to find
answers.3: sometimes — some mental states trace to inputs, others don't

questions.text: I can connect periods of mental clarity or fog to what I was consuming ...
questions.principle: Mental state correlates with mental investment

answers.4: usually — I can trace most mental states to inputs
answers.5: clearly — my mental state reflects my mental diet
answers.3: sometimes — some periods connect clearly, others don't
answers.1: not at all — clarity comes and goes randomly

remediation.advice: Audit your information diet for one week. Write down everything you consume mentally — social media, news, conversations, entertainment. Then look at your mental state. The connection between input and output will become obvious.

scripture.text: Finally, brothers, whatever is true, whatever is honorable, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is lovely, whatever is commendable... think about these things.
